intro: Phanera merrilliana, commonly known as the Malay orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually pink or white and attract various pollinators.
